messages.message: hey folks :wave: ! How do we feel about providing SC a patch to fix the broken OCR add/delete stuff that @Eric Han fixed in https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/FLOW-90? /cc @Nithin
I’d be pro doing this if we can do it in a clean way. Mani emailed me last night about this, and he’s pretty fired up about quality issues right now
This PR is pretty standalone so shouldn't be an issue if we pick it into another release
@Handsome Dave how do you feel about this?
Assuming the `release-2020-02-03`  branch matches _exactly_ what they are running right now, so we can just cherry-pick the fix in? I’m perfectly good with it. @sudeep can you confirm?
I can test the feature once we get it into an environment
@Handsome Dave I confirmed this with Sudeep yesterday night.  All the changes are in.  @Eric Han can you please request a PR with the old release branch
Just making sure that there are no merge conflicts etc.
after that's all done, @Handsome Dave or I can get it to them and make sure there are no problems getting it deployed.
I can get it done, as soon as the release branch is updated.
I’m merging the fix when travis finishes into the feb release. Webapp and Nginx need to be repushed

@Handsome Dave there are two release branch `release-2020-02-03` and `release-2020-02-03.sc (http://release-2020-02-03.sc)` . I don't know if deploying from the former will break their LDAP connectivity. @sudeep will have more context.
That’s the specific thing I was thinking about, but @shaunak says he’s confirmed it’s all in the main branch. :crossed_fingers:

Both branches are in sync wrt LDAP connectivity, so deploying from either is fine.  `release-2020-02-03` has additional commits outside of LDAP fixes, that were not shipped to SC earlier in case you want to confirm that they are OK to ship @Handsome Dave.
